module.name: errors
module.short: Convert unix error codes to string message
module.descr: The errors unit contains routines to convert a unix system call error code to an error message: . It is only available on unix platforms.

element.name: sys_errn
element.descr: sys_errn is the number of error codes for the current operating system. It should not be used directly, instead use .

element.name: sys_errlist
element.descr: sys_errn is an array with then error codes for the current operating system. It should not be used directly, instead use .

element.name: StrError
element.short: Convert an error code to a string
element.descr: StrError will convert the error code err to a string.
element.errors: If the error code is unknown or out of bounds, an 'Unknown error (err)' string will be returned.

element.name: StrError.Result
element.short: Error message corresponding to error code Err

element.name: StrError.err
element.short: Error code to return string from

element.name: PError
element.short: Print error on standard error routput
element.descr: PError will print the error message S followed by the errNo and the result for StrError(errNo) for ErrNo on standard output.

element.name: PError.s
element.short: Short message to print before error number

element.name: PError.Errno
element.short: Error number to print, followed by corresponding error text
